item.title: Police: Gas prices fuel stabbing...
item.description:
www.ctpost.com
BRIDGEPORT - A local man is accused of stabbing two people following an argument about the high gas prices. Algie Womack, 54, of Bretton Street, was charged with attempted murder, first-degree assault, second-degree assault, threatening and breach of peace. He was being held in lieu of $200,000 bond. Police said officers were patrolling Main Street Tuesday morning when they heard a woman screaming from the parking lot at St. Vincent's Medical Center. The woman, her dress soaked in blood, complained she had just been stabbed and told officers her assailant had fled on Main Street.

item.title: 81-year-old runs for life, survives 1000-sting bee attack!
item.description:
www.chron.com
A Tarkington man is recovering from an aggressive bee attack that resulted in more than 1,000 bee stings. Tom Mizell, 81, known for his roadside vegetable stand on CR 2224 in Tarkington, says he was mowing a field on CR 2184 just off of FM 2518 on June 26 when he was attacked by bees. "I was running a dozer in the woods, helping my cousin clear a right-of-way for a fence. All of a sudden, I saw a black cloud of bees surrounding me," he said. "I jumped off the dozer, which happened to be in neutral. I left it running and took off through the woods, trying to make my way to a little lake I had dug on the property.
